org.jlinalg.optimise

Class RandomGradientDescent<RESIDUAL extends IRingElement<RESIDUAL>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlinalg.optimise.RandomGradientDescent<RESIDUAL>
  • Type Parameters:
    RESIDUAL - the type of the residual.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Optimiser<RESIDUAL>

    public class RandomGradientDescent<RESIDUAL extends IRingElement<RESIDUAL>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Optimiser<RESIDUAL>
    An implementation of an optimiser: Among the parameters, one is randomly choosen and then this dimension is searched along the gradient with a decreasing step size if the residual does not decreases. if the residual increases, the step size is increased somewhat. All dimensions of the parameter vector are searched in random order, but all are searched as often.
    The minima and maxima for the search domain are respected.
    The search is perpetuated until no decrease in the residual is observed or the maximal number of optimisation steps is reached (see maxOptimisationSteps).

    If syncronisation (i.e. during access to the residal) is necessary, this should be done on the target.

    Author:
    Georg Thimm

        public int getOptimisationStepsTaken()
        Specified by:
        getOptimisationStepsTaken in interface Optimiser<RESIDUAL extends IRingElement<RESIDUAL>>
        Returns:
        the number of steps taken during the last call of Optimiser.optimise(). If optimise did not yet terminate, this is the current number of steps. -1 if no optimisation was executed.
